channel.title: Kudos to the Black Mesa Vox
channel.description: I was wondering how I would do a Black Mesa Vox (PA system) in my map. My experiments to use my own voice in Audacity weren't going so well. So, I decided to see what lines already existed. And, to my surprise, I was delighted to see that you guys implemented the vox on a word-by-word basis! That's freakin' awesome! I was able to retrofit my intended dialog to use these existing words. Really cool.

item.title: Kudos to the Black Mesa Vox
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Heh, neat, I hadn’t noticed that.
It was missing from the mod version (due to an error in a junk-file remover, IIRC) but now that the entirety of the vox lines are back, it seems they elected to do it HL1 style.

Which is good, because HL1’s vox was designed for mappers to have full flexibility on the lines.

Read full topic
item.source: Kudos to the Black Mesa Vox

item.title: Kudos to the Black Mesa Vox
item.dc:creator: Maki
item.description:
I was wondering how I would do a Black Mesa Vox (PA system) in my map. My experiments to use my own voice in Audacity weren’t going so well. So, I decided to see what lines already existed. And, to my surprise, I was delighted to see that you guys implemented the vox on a word-by-word basis! That’s freakin’ awesome! I was able to retrofit my intended dialog to use these existing words. Really cool.
